required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anlotinib Combined With Dose-dense Temozolomide for the First Recurrent or Progressive Glioblastoma After STUPP Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Anlotinib Combined With Dose-dense Temozolomide for the First Recurrent or Progressive Glioblastoma After STUPP Regimen

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Nanchang University

brief_summary.textblock: Currently,6 cycles of Temozolomide adjuvant chemotherapy after concurrent radiotherapy and Temozolomide chemotherapy(STUPP regimen)for newly diagnosed postoperative GBM can increase the 2-year and 5-year overall survival rates of patients to 26.5% and 9.8%, respectively. However, most patients are still unable to avoid tumor recurrence and death.Anlotinib is an efficient multi-target tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) that effectively block the migration and proliferation of endothelial cells and reduce tumor microvascular density by targeting VEGFRs, FGFRs, PDGFRs. It has been proved to be safe and effective in advanced lung cancer(including NSCLC,SCLC)after second-line standard chemotherapy failure,and advanced soft tissue sarcoma after anthracycline-containing chemotherapy failure.Here, we prepared to evaluate whether the combination of dose-dense Temozolomide and Anlotinib can preferably improved survival of the first recurrent or progressive GBM after STUPP regimen.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (Partial Response [PR] Plus Complete Response [CR]), as Assessed Using as Assessed by Investigator Using RANO Version 1.1
6 months Progression-Free Survival Rates as Assessed by Investigator Using RANO Version 1.1

secondary_outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) as Assessed by Investigator Using RANO Version 1.1
OS was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause.
Toxic side effects as Assessed by Investigator Using RANO Version 1.1

intervention.description: Temozolomide Capsule 150mg, p.o., qd, d1-7,15-21,4 weeks one cycle; Anlotinib hydrochloride capsule 12mg, p.o., qd, D1-D14; 3 weeks one cycle.
